result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cortney N Drew

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:40 PM Defendant Cortney N Drew not in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by phone for Cortney N Drew.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson states that his client did do her assessment; requests another status in 60 days.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cortney N Drew not in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by phone for Cortney N Drew. 
Atty Johnson states an assessment is being completed.  Requests further status.
BY THE COURT:  Set for status.
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cortney N Drew not in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by phone for Cortney N Drew. 
Atty Johnson states that the matter is almost resolved but his client needs to complete her AODA; requests status.

BY THE COURT;  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cortney N Drew not in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Cortney N Drew. 
Atty Johnson states that the alleged victim in the matter has passed away and will be meeting with the DA next week; requests status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:51 PM Defendant Cortney N Drew not in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Cortney N Drew.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson asks for a reset so he can go over discovery with his client.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Status hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

**Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days  Defendant is to contact Booking at 608-297-3053 and schedule a time to complete booking in next 30 days.  Booking is done on Tuesday's on the 2nd floor of the Courthouse.

10:38 AM Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video means for Defendant Cortney N Drew. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Johnson received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
BY THE COURT: Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.
Atty Juech requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT: Court sets $500 signature bond with conditions.  Status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
